description: You need ocean water, says Kuuleialoha Gaisoa, 45, whose family has been harvesting salt in Hanapepe, on the west side of Kauai, for generations. In Hawaiian, the word for salt is paakai, meaning to solidify the sea, and the salt from the patch that Gaisoa works is known throughout the islands for its sweet, briny flavor and cultural significance in rituals and ceremonies. Gaisoa knows people who carry the salt in their purses and bury it around their homes as a kind of protection. The 22 families who work the salt patch never sell salt; they only gift or trade it. If you give someone a little baggie, theyll split up their baggie and give it to their friends, Gaisoa says.

title: What Should I Do About the Abusive Mom Down the Hall?
description: I live in a large apartment complex. Since I moved in several months ago, I have heard my neighbor down the hall  a single mother of color  repeatedly hitting and screaming obscenities at her two young children, who are both under the age of 10. These are not casual slaps (if there are such things) or a parent raising her voice. The children are wailing in response to being hit  I can hear it all through the door, and the mother threatening to throw the children out. It happens multiple times a week, and I can hear all of this in my apartment down the hall. I do not want to involve the police for obvious reasons and can only imagine how stressful it would be to care for two young children in an apartment alone during a pandemic. It is also obvious, however, that the childrens welfare is at stake. But I am afraid that if I say something, the children will be put in an even worse situation. Do I talk to the mother directly? It seems unlikely that will seriously change whatever forces have compelled her to parent this way. What would you advise? Name Withheld

title: How to Make Your Own Incense
description: I asked Hyungi Park, an artist in Los Angeles, to break down the steps.

title: The British Activist Who Was a Spiritual Ancestor to Todays Teen Radicals
description: SYLVIA PANKHURST Natural Born RebelBy Rachel Holmes

title: No One Loves Arbys Like I Do
description: My childhood was defined by two rituals: three hours of Mormon Church service on Sundays and a trip to Arbys almost as regularly. The Arbys location in my Texas hometown possessed all the visual splendor that the church I was raised in did not: stained glass and smoky wood paneling, sauce packets stored in a long buffet under heat lamps. And yet it was, in some ways, an extension of the church. The location was managed by a family friend from our congregation, a man I knew as the Colonel, who was something of a surrogate grandparent to me.

title: What if the Great American Novelist Doesnt Write Novels?
description: I gave Frederick Wiseman a call on the morning of Election Day. It was 3 in the afternoon his time, in Paris, where he keeps a small apartment at Les Rcollets, a Franciscan friary built in 1603 and converted four centuries later into housing for visiting artists and scholars. Wisemans home  and wife, Zipporah, and production company, also named Zipporah  all remain in Cambridge, Mass. But he has found Paris, a city he has been enamored of since the 1950s, when he enrolled in law classes at the Sorbonne to secure an early Army discharge, amenable to his creative process, and he has edited several of his films there. In mid-March, he finished the sound mix for City Hall, his 45th feature, just as Emmanuel Macron announced a national lockdown. As fall arrived, with his new four-and-a-half-hour documentary opening at largely virtual film festivals (Venice, New York, Toronto) to rapturous reviews, Wiseman, who in a normal year would have walked one or more of the red carpets, remained sidelined in France, thousands of miles from his family and unable to begin his next project. It was the first time in 55 years he hadnt been working on a film, Wiseman told me. When I asked how hed been holding up, he noted flatly, Well, in addition to being scared, Im bored. His doctors had advised him not to fly, primarily, he said, because Im of the age Covid likes. Wiseman will celebrate his 91st birthday on New Years Day.

title: Three Books That Gaze Upward to Heaven and Inward to the Heart
description: DANGEROUS RELIGIOUS IDEASThe Deep Roots of Self-Critical Faith in Judaism, Christianity, and IslamBy Rachel S. Mikva

title: Covid Stole My Sense of Smell. The Citys Not the Same.
description: I imagined that my doctors sterile white office smelled of acrid bleach or hints of ethyl alcohol from the hand sanitizer dispensers sprinkled throughout it, but I couldnt say for sure. He asked me about my symptoms and took notes.

title: The Rise of Incense
description: Hyungi Park, a Los Angeles-based artist, began learning how to make incense six years ago. She admits that incense isnt necessarily the most eco-friendly option, compared with candles or essential oils, but thinks that its definitely more for the mood. The different functions of incense and the history behind it makes it special to her, especially because it is tied to religious ceremonies. Incense feels more intentional, said Ms. Park.

title: Got $1 Million to Spare? You Can Buy an Ambassadorship
description: Who wouldnt want to be an American ambassador?

title: The Healing Power of Music
description: Patients undergoing surgery who listen to soothing talk and music while under anesthesia may wake up feeling less pain and require less pain medicine.

title: If the Republican Party Doesnt Shape Up, We Will Challenge It
description: Donald Trumps refusal to accept his electoral defeat is alarming, but unsurprising. It is Mr. Trumps character to reject even reality itself when it conflicts with his ego. More alarming is the long list of state and national Republican leaders cravenly falling in line behind his desperate efforts to topple American democracy.

title: Who Do You Think Should Be Person of the Year for 2020?
description: What person or group of people do you think best represents 2020?

title: Bonus: Kara and Maggie Haberman Debrief on Brad Raffensperger
description: Karas conversation with Georgias Secretary of State was a doozy. She called up Times White House correspondent Maggie Haberman to discuss.

title: Tech Companies Shift Their Posture on a Legal Shield, Wary of Being Left Behind
description: WASHINGTON  For more than two decades, the tech industry had a cohesive message to Congress about a law that shields internet platforms from lawsuits: Dont touch it.

title: Trapped at Home in the Pandemic With Mold and a Leaky Roof
description: Aida Corporan has avoided the coronavirus by hunkering down in her apartment at the Bailey Houses, a public housing complex in the Bronx.

title: If Teachers Get the Vaccine Quickly, Can Students Get Back to School?
description: States and cities across the country are moving to put teachers near the front of the line to receive a coronavirus vaccine, in an effort to make it safer to return to classrooms and provide relief to struggling students and weary parents.

title: We Are Not Done With Abolition
description: Early this month, a group of Democratic members of Congress introduced an Abolition Amendment to the U.S. Constitution. Why, in the year 2020, does the Constitution need an amendment dealing with the abolition of slavery? Wasnt that accomplished over a century and a half ago?

title: The Restorative Power of Secret Food Rituals
description: Heres how Ive gotten through 2020: Every week when I do my familys grocery shopping, right before I check out, I swing by the stores sushi counter and pick up one salmon avocado roll and one spicy tuna roll. Sometimes they dont have spicy tuna rolls. But the sushi guy knows me, so he just nods over his mask and I nod over my mask, and then I go grab a Diet Coke while he makes me a fresh roll. After I pay, I put the groceries in the trunk of my car, douse myself in hand sanitizer and take the sushi and Diet Coke into the front seat. I lock the doors, put on a podcast, and for 15 blissful minutes, I eat my sushi, alone in my car in the grocery store parking lot. And it is heaven.

title: Did the Resistance Defeat Donald Trump?
description: Two of the most intense factions in our politics, the anti-Trump Resistance with its claim to be standing against fascism and the conservatives trying to delegitimize Joe Bidens victory with claims of widespread voter fraud, agree on almost nothing, but they do agree on one point: The Trump administration was successfully undermined  the Trump agenda thwarted and Donald Trump himself defeated  by liberal institutions that refused to normalize him, maintained a persistent alarm about his presidency and took every opportunity to obstruct, investigate, protest and impeach.

title: Cathedral Shooting in Manhattan: What We Know About the Gunman
description: A holiday concert on the steps of a Manhattan church was intended to be a gift to the neighborhood at the end of a year that has taken a toll on the city.

title: Parenting With Agoraphobia Is Hard. Its Harder in a Pandemic.
description: All you do is sit inside! My 6-year-old roared, running to her room to slam the door in my face.

title: In Bad Shape and Getting Worse, Guantnamo Poses Headaches for Biden
description: WASHINGTON  As tropical rains swamped the U.S. Navy base at Guantnamo Bay this summer and fall, raw sewage sloshed inside the cells where the military has imprisoned Khalid Shaikh Mohammed and other so-called high-value Qaeda detainees for more than a decade, the prisoners told their lawyers.

title: Delivery Workers in South Korea Say Theyre Dying of Overwork
Inside the Right-Wing Media Bubble, Where the Myth of a Trump Win Lives On
description: President Trumps media criticism is usually binary  there are good stories, favorable to him, and then the other category.

title: The Undoing of Jeffrey Toobin
description: Until Jeffrey Toobins fateful appointment with Zoom on Oct. 15, his quarantine was going better than most peoples.

title: A Desert Home Filled With Instagrammable Moments
description: For one couple, updating a midcentury-modern house near Palm Springs wasnt just about respecting the architecture. It was about making it pop.

title: With First Dibs on Vaccines, Rich Countries Have Cleared the Shelves
description: As a growing number of coronavirus vaccines advance through clinical trials, wealthy countries are fueling an extraordinary gap in access around the world, laying claim to more than half the doses that could come on the market by the end of next year.

title: With Most Pantomimes Canceled, Another Blow to U.K. Theaters
description: LONDON  Every year, for the past 42 years, Berwick Kaler has spent all of December and half of January onstage, wearing an elaborately hideous, multicolored hooped dress, workmans boots and a bright orange wig.

title: Inside Bidens Struggle to Manage Factions in the Democratic Party
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. is confronting factionalism and fierce impatience within his own party, as the groups that make up the Democratic coalition see President Trump crumbling as an adversary and turn toward the battle to define the personnel and policies of a new administration.

title: An Instagram-Friendly Renovation, Complete With Disco Ball
description: Even when Jillian and Tim Sassone lived in Brooklyn, the city of Palm Springs, Calif., had a special place in their hearts. Enamored of the areas mix of desert, mountains and midcentury modern design, they held their wedding there in 2010.

title: How to Pretend Youre in Singapore Tonight
description: It took over a dozen visits to Singapore for me to fall in love with it. But when I did, I fell hard. As a teenager living in Jakarta, Indonesia  just under two hours away by direct flight  I looked at Singapores shiny veneer and dismissed the whole place as shallow and materialistic. It was one big shopping mall, I thought, with too many rules and not enough character. But then, as I kept going back, I intentionally squashed my preconceptions and I started noticing other things. I quickly realized how much I had been missing.

title: Sylvia Pankhurst: Natural Born Rebel, by Rachel Holmes: An Excerpt
description: Love and enthusiasm are the two great moving factors which make life worth living. This I aver in spite of all the materialists. A free spirit and a visionary, Estelle Sylvia Pankhurst was by nature an artist. Yet she became one of the greatest unsung political figures of the twentieth century.

title: Vaccine Distribution Is Underway in New York
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: Rich countries have first dibs on vaccines, while poor nations struggle to get enough.
description: As a growing number of vaccines advance through clinical trials, wealthy countries are fueling an extraordinary gap in access around the world, laying claim to more than half the doses that could come on the market by the end of next year.

title: Court Finds Evidence of Crimes Against Humanity in the Philippines
description: MANILA  The International Criminal Court issued a preliminary report on Tuesday in which it said there was evidence to show crimes against humanity had been committed in the Philippines under President Rodrigo Duterte, whose bloody drug war has left thousands dead since 2016.

title: Tighter virus restrictions in London add to pressure on Boris Johnson.
description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson was already facing a treacherous week as he weighs whether to strike a Brexit trade deal with the European Union. Now, he faces pressure on another front, after his government on Monday imposed tighter restrictions on London to curb a virus flare-up.

title: The first Covid-19 vaccines bring Americans hope in small doses.
description: Some of the medical centers that have endured the worst of the coronavirus outbreak in the United States found the gloom that has long filled their corridors replaced by elation and hope on Monday as health care workers became the first to take part in a mass vaccination campaign aimed at ending the pandemic.

title: Heres why Brazils Covid-19 vaccine plan is mired in chaos.
description: As countries rushed their preparations to inoculate citizens against the coronavirus, Brazil, with its world-renowned immunization program and a robust pharmaceutical manufacturing capacity, should have been at a significant advantage.

title: Delivery workers in South Korea say theyre dying of overwork.
description: At a logistics depot in southern Seoul, couriers recently held a ritual at the start of another grueling work day: They stood for a moment of silence to remember 15 fellow couriers who they say died this year from overwork.

title: A Black Students Mother Complained About Fences. He Was Expelled.
description: When the mother of a Black ninth grader at a private school in Charlotte, N.C., learned last month that his English class was going to be studying August Wilsons Fences, an acclaimed play examining racism in 1950s America, she complained to the school.

title: If teachers get vaccinated quickly, can students go back to school?
description: In Arizona, where several schools have moved online in recent weeks amid a virus surge, Gov. Doug Ducey declared that teachers would be among the very first people inoculated. Teachers are essential to our state, he said. Utahs governor, Gary Herbert, talked about possibly getting shots to educators this month. And Los Angeles officials urged prioritizing teachers alongside firefighters and prison guards.

title: Americas First Coronavirus Vaccinations
description: It was like a scene from a movie. In North Dakota, health care workers lifted a bag of dry ice covering one of the states first shipments of the coronavirus vaccine and a cloud filled the room. The strict guidelines governing the vaccines storage make even opening the box a complex and time-sensitive process.

title: In a Hard Year, Families Find Joy in Real Christmas Trees
description: When Allison Protsko was a child, the arrival of the Christmas season meant driving with her family to pick out a Christmas tree, cutting it down themselves and dragging it home.

title: Japans Twitter Killer Given Death Sentence for 9 Murders
description: TOKYO  A Japanese court on Thursday sentenced to death a man who had confessed to stalking and murdering women who had expressed suicidal thoughts on social media, bringing an end to a grisly case that played to many of the countrys social anxieties.

title: The Fast Path to a Vaccine
description: Before Covid-19, the record for the fastest vaccine development  for mumps  was four years. Most vaccines have required more than a decade of research and experimentation.

title: Tenet | Anatomy of a Scene
description: The writer and director Christopher Nolan narrates an action scene from Tenet.

title: Somalia Severs Diplomatic Ties With Kenya
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Somalia severed diplomatic ties with Kenya on Tuesday, accusing the neighboring East African nation of meddling in its internal political affairs weeks before a crucial general election.

title: No Labels, Planning Centrist Push in New Congress, Taps Larry Hogan
description: WASHINGTON  The bipartisan political organization No Labels named Gov. Larry Hogan of Maryland, a Republican, as its new national co-chairman on Tuesday as it pushed lawmakers to embrace centrist policies in a new Congress.

title: Watch the Stars of Tenet Leap Tall Buildings
description: In Anatomy of a Scene, we ask directors to reveal the secrets that go into making key scenes in their movies. See new episodes in the series on Fridays. You can also watch our collection of more than 150 videos on YouTube and subscribe to our YouTube channel.

title: Faith in Our Institutions Held
description: The Electoral College votes, affirming Bidens victory. So now its official, again. Its Tuesday, and this is your politics tip sheet. Sign up here to get On Politics in your inbox every weekday.

title: Blade Takes Off for the Stock Markets
description: Blade Urban Air Mobility, the New York-based helicopter taxi service, has struck a deal to go public via a sale to a blank-check company backed by KSL Capital that values the company at about $825 million. The deal includes $400 million in proceeds, which includes a $125 million infusion along with the cash in the SPAC. Pending the deals closure, it will trade on the Nasdaq under the ticker BLDE.

title: Hungary Passes Laws Curtailing Gay Rights and Expanding Executive Power
description: BUDAPEST  The Hungarian Parliament passed a raft of sweeping measures on Tuesday that curtail the rights of gay citizens and make it more difficult for opposition parties to challenge Prime Minister Viktor Orban and his party in future elections.

title: I.C.C. Wont Investigate Chinas Detention of Muslims
description: The International Criminal Court has decided not to pursue an investigation into Chinas mass detention of Muslims, a setback for activists eager to hold Beijing accountable for persecution of ethnic and religious minorities.

title: Still at Home for the Holidays
description: Like many Americans, Jacob Underwood, a 39-year-old who works in finance, will be staying put for the holidays because of the pandemic. I usually travel somewhere exotic, he said. Its very sad.

title: Moderna Vaccine Is Highly Protective Against Covid-19, the F.D.A. Finds
description: WASHINGTON  The coronavirus vaccine made by Moderna is highly protective, according to new data released on Tuesday, setting the stage for its emergency authorization this week by federal regulators and the start of its distribution across the country.

title: Biden won the Electoral College, but Trumps attacks on the process will have lasting effects on democracy.
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.s victory was affirmed by the Electoral College on Monday, despite President Trumps relentless promotion of conspiracy theories and attacks on the integrity of the results.

title: Families at the border will present a familiar test for Bidens Homeland Security pick.
description: Alejandro N. Mayorkas, President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.s choice to lead the Department of Homeland Security, will immediately face the challenge of rolling back President Trumps restrictive immigration policies, while balancing demands from the left for more lenient policies with those of the moderates who see any show of tolerance as an instigator to an uptick in illegal migration.

title: The next vaccine challenge is to reassure older Americans.
description: Older Americans are pivotal to the success of the vaccination campaign rolling out across the United States. They are the most likely to be hospitalized and to die from Covid-19, and the least likely to muster a strong immune response to the coronavirus.

title: Wary Companies Hesitate on Super Bowl Commercials, Citing Pandemic
description: It seemed like money well spent, when Sabra paid millions to book a 30-second slot for the 2020 Super Bowl.

title: More Senate Republicans warily accept Trumps loss after Electoral College vote.
description: Support for President Trumps attempt to overturn his election loss began to collapse in the Senate on Monday after the Electoral College certified President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.s victory, with many of the chambers top Republicans saying the time had come to recognize results that have been evident for weeks.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: $2.325 MILLION

title: How Biden Can Move His Economic Agenda Without Congress
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.s ability to reshape the economy through legislation hinges in large part on the outcome of the two Georgia runoffs in January that will decide control of the Senate. But even without a cooperative Congress, his administration will be able to act on its agenda of raising workers standard of living and creating good jobs by taking a series of unilateral actions under existing law.

title: Modular Construction Meets Changing Needs in the Pandemic
description: When the University of Denver reopened for classes this fall, there was a new building on campus next to the student athletics center: a coronavirus testing center created using modular construction.

title: Endeavor Expands N.B.A. Talent Reach With Stake in BDA Sports
description: Endeavor, the entertainment and sports conglomerate, expanded its sports representation business Tuesday by purchasing a stake in BDA Sports Management, the firm led by the influential N.B.A. agent Bill Duffy.

title: Vaccines Come With a Dose of Caution in California
description: Good morning.

title: Another Effect of Covid: Thousands of Double Proxy Weddings
description: Randy Nuez and Sasha Nuez-Carvalho were married in October while he was quarantined with the coronavirus in San Diego and she was deployed by the Navy, 4,000 miles away, in Europe. Ms. Nuez-Carvalho was drinking at a bar when her fiance, now husband, called her to tell her the news.

title: Biden will have to make difficult decisions about the Guantnamo Bay prison.
description: The incoming Biden administration has yet to lay out plans for the Guantnamo Bay military prison on the U.S. Navy base where leftover fragments of the Bush administrations most disputed responses to the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks remain unresolved three presidencies later.

title: Heat and the TV Movie That Paved Its Way to Becoming a Classic
description: Early in Michael Manns 1995 crime drama Heat, his protagonist destroys a television set. It makes sense in the context of the film (well, sort of), but it also can be read as a wink: Mann, a writer, director and producer who made his name with the TV smash Miami Vice (not to mention Crime Story), taking a moment from his star-studded, big-screen epic to bite the hand that fed him.

title: Keegan-Michael Key Reaches into the Past With Midnight Run and Electric Ladyland
description: The world may have turned upside-down this year, but the actor-producer Keegan-Michael Key has grounded himself in his work, finding a refuge from the isolation and anxiety of the pandemic.

title: A Deeper, Darker Look at James Beard, Food Oracle and Gay Man
description: Fifty years ago, this is how the foremost American food authority described his favorite menu for a holiday open house:

title: McConnell congratulates Biden and lobbies colleagues to oppose a final-stage G.O.P. effort to overturn his victory.
description: Breaking with President Trumps drive to overturn his election loss, Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky on Tuesday congratulated President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. on his victory and began a campaign to keep fellow Republicans from joining a last-ditch effort to reverse the outcome when Congress tallies the results next month.

title: These Educators and Activists Can Help You Navigate Intimacy Now
description: This year, physical distance and safety became part of a suddenly urgent conversation for everyone. But for educators focused on intimacy and consent, questions about bodies and boundaries are a constant focus. Heres how a number of experts are teaching people how to treat themselves and others well  and where they can teach you.

title: Big Fines and Strict Rules Unveiled Against Big Tech in Europe
description: LONDON  Authorities in the European Union and Britain built momentum on Tuesday for tougher oversight of the technology industry, as they introduced new regulations to pressure the worlds biggest tech companies to take down harmful content and open themselves up to more competition.

title: Use It or Lose It: Tenant Aid Effort Nears a Federal Cutoff
description: For several months, Gregory Heller, an official with a Philadelphia nonprofit group, has grappled with an unusual problem. He had $60 million in rental aid to help low-income tenants weather the pandemic  and a whole lot of trouble spending it.

title: Biden struggles to manage the Democratic Partys competing interests.
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. is confronting outbreaks of factionalism and fierce impatience within his own party, as the groups that make up the Democratic coalition see President Trump crumbling as an adversary and turn instead toward the battle to define the personnel and policies of a new administration.

title: Taylor Swifts Evermore: Lets Discuss
description: Less than five months after Taylor Swift surprise-released Folklore, which she conceived and recorded wholly within pandemic isolation, comes a follow-up album, Evermore, on which she works with many of the same collaborators, including Aaron Dessner, Jack Antonoff and Justin Vernon.

title: In New Hampshire, the governor will wait his turn to get the vaccine.
description: It was not quite 30 degrees in Manchester, N.H.  with a wind chill of 19  but Gov. Chris Sununu looked relieved and happy as the first few health care workers in the state were vaccinated against Covid-19 Tuesday morning outside the Elliot Hospital.

title: The Last Blockbuster Review: All the Nostalgia, With No Late Fees
description: You ever hear the one about the guy who asked for Of Human Bondage at the video store and was told to look in the adult section? I saw it happen. In the 80s. A fair amount of The Last Blockbuster, a documentary on video stores  and on one store in particular, as the title implies  spends time with Gen X folks kicking around not dissimilar reminiscences.

title: How Full Are Hospital I.C.U.s Near You?
description: See how many Covid-19 patients are being treated, and how many I.C.U. beds remain available, at individual U.S. hospitals.

title: As U.S. Vaccinations Begin, Hope Mixes With Worry
description: To the Editor:

title: Outdoor Dining Confronts Its Latest Challenge: Snow
description: [Noreaster live updates: Messy snowstorm moves up the East Coast.]

title: Holiday Cheer, Spiked or Straight
description: Taylor Macs autumn-harvest headdress is such an elaborate landscape of apples and gourds that the gleaming green talons reaching out of it come across as a subtle touch.

title: Man Is Jailed After Taking Jet Ski Across Irish Sea to See Girlfriend
description: LONDON  Last Thursday, Dale Mclaughlan bought a Jet Ski.

title: One Wild Mink Near Utah Fur Farms Tests Positive for Virus
description: A wild mink in Utah has tested positive for the coronavirus. Mink on fur farms in the area have been infected with the virus, and the U.S. Agriculture Department, with other government agencies, was testing wild animals looking for potential infections spreading from those farms.

title: Inauguration planners ask Americans to stay home on Jan. 20 and watch the historic event virtually.
description: The committee charged with planning the inauguration of President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Vice President-elect Kamala Harris is asking the public to stay home on Jan. 20 and participate in virtual activities instead.

title: East Coast Braces for Winter Storm on Wednesday
description: A major winter storm is forecast to sweep through parts of the Mid-Atlantic States and the Northeast starting early Wednesday, sending heavy snow, freezing rain and strong winds surging through the region into Thursday.

title: After Wildfires, Mourning the Loss of Californias Giants
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: Monarch Butterflies Qualify for Endangered List. They Still Wont Be Protected.
description: The monarch butterfly is threatened with extinction, but will not come under federal protection because other species are a higher priority, federal officials announced Tuesday.

title: What Is Jos Mourinho Telling Us on Instagram?
description: LONDON  The content itself does not, when you type the words, sound especially fascinating. A 15-second video of a man buffing his shoes. A photograph of that moment he checked his phone in the snow, or that time he sat on a bus, or the day he ate some popcorn.

title: Ann Reinking: Playful, Refined and With Legs for Days
description: When I think of Ann Reinking, I see legs. Legs in shimmering black tights. Legs in heels. Legs that extend effortlessly to a 6 oclock extension. They werent the only thing that made her dancing so resplendent, but they were the anchor to her daring. Aside from their shape, they had a strength that rooted her body, giving her pelvic isolations a silky sort of groove and her precision a natural, teasing sensuality. Even stretched out on a bed, her legs could tell a story.

title: Online Shopping Is Amazing. Or Is It?
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

title: Fashion Mogul Peter Nygard Indicted on Sex-Trafficking Charges
description: Peter Nygard, the Canadian fashion executive, has been charged with sex trafficking, racketeering conspiracy and other crimes that involved dozens of women and teenage girls as victims in the United States, the Bahamas and Canada, federal prosecutors in Manhattan said on Tuesday.

title: A New Breed of Animal Documentary
description: Theres a moment in Gunda, an artful documentary about barnyard animals, that could take its place in a list of the years best scenes. The star, a sow with a bustling litter of piglets, has just experienced an unmistakable trauma. Pacing around the farm, she conveys a palpable agitation and emotion, before turning to look at the camera, pointedly.

title: A snowstorm in the Northeast threatens to snarl vaccine deliveries.
description: A major winter storm is bearing down on the Northeast, from Virginia to New England, with the potential to snarl distribution of the Pfizer-BioNTech coronavirus vaccine in the region.

title: Violent Tragedy Upends a Bible Belt Town in This Brisk Novel
description: THE ANCIENT HOURSBy Michael Bible

title: New Restaurant Offerings Amid the Pandemic
description: The suspension of indoor dining in New York City ordered by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is a blow to the restaurants struggling to stay afloat and keep their workers employed. Since the pandemic started, many have tried creative solutions like sharing kitchen space or offering meal kits. Some restaurants, like Avena Downtown, have turned their premises into pop-up shops, or opened markets adjacent to their spaces. Others are joining forces to sell food from their menus, or to become restaurants within restaurants; Osteria Morini, Lafayette and Frenchette have spun-off bakeries.

title: Panel Finds Serious Concerns With Mexican Labor Reforms
description: WASHINGTON  Mexico has made progress in putting in place the sweeping overhauls to its labor system required by the new trade agreement between the United States, Mexico and Canada, but serious challenges still remain, according to a new report by an independent board set up to evaluate those changes.

title: Review: Catching Up to The Expanse, the Space Opera You Love
description: Every year at this time, I and my colleagues on the television beat publish our lists of the years best shows and wait, with much interest and some resignation, to be told what we missed. Our most egregious omissions this year, according to readers, included new shows like Netflixs Queens Gambit, Apple TV+s Ted Lasso and HBOs How to With John Wilson.

title: The Virus Trains: How Lockdown Chaos Spread Covid-19 Across India
description: SURAT, India  The crowds surged through the gates, fought their way up the stairs of the 160-year-old station, poured across the platforms and engulfed the trains.

title: What We Saw on Day 1 of the Vaccine Rollout
description: Times correspondents report on the first coronavirus vaccinations in the United States.

title: New York City Cultural Groups Awarded More Than $47 Million in Grants
description: In a year filled with layoffs and budget cuts, New York Citys cultural institutions got some good news on Tuesday: The Department of Cultural Affairs announced that it would award $47.1 million in its newest round of grants, which this year will go to more than 1,000 of the citys nonprofit organizations.

title: New At-Home Covid Test Gets Green Light From F.D.A.
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Tuesday issued an emergency authorization for the countrys first coronavirus test that can run from start to finish at home without the need for a prescription.

title: I Cant Stop Watching Coronavirus Vaccine Videos
description: All I seem to want to do these days is stare mindlessly at health care workers and the elderly getting stuck in the arm with a needle.

title: Biden picks Pete Buttigieg for transportation secretary.
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. will nominate Pete Buttigieg, the former mayor of South Bend, Ind., to lead the Department of Transportation, adding a young-generation voice to his team, the transition team announced on Tuesday.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: The U.S., Britain, Canada and others are rolling out coronavirus vaccines after ordering doses that far outnumber their populations. Theyve already laid claim to more than half of the doses coming on the market through 2021, as many poorer nations struggle to secure enough.

title: Nursing Home Fire in Russia Kills 11
description: MOSCOW  Two years ago, a private nursing home opened in a village outside the hardscrabble capital of Russias steel industry, Magnitogorsk. The home, a social-media advertisement said, was meant for people whose own family cannot, for this or that reason, provide the necessary care.

title: Biden to Face a Confrontational Russia in a World Changed From His Time in Office
description: WASHINGTON  The extensive hack of American government computer systems, almost certainly orchestrated by the Kremlin, underscores the daunting foreign policy challenge that President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia poses to the incoming Biden administration.

title: Tara VanDerveers Current Math: 1,099 Wins and Counting
description: One day in the ninth grade, Tara VanDerveer was playing basketball  as she did most days while growing up in upstate New York  when her father interrupted the bounce, bounce, bounce of the ball and ordered her into the house. He wanted her to work on what he viewed as a less trivial pursuit: her math homework.

title: When Publishing Women Was a Radical Act: A British Editor Looks Back
description: Lennie Goodings, the chair of the trailblazing feminist press Virago, was 5 years old when she spotted her first typo. I pointed it out to my mother and that was when it first dawned on me that there were humans behind books, she said in a 2013 interview. It felt like a secret discovery.

title: Critical to Vaccines, Cold Storage Is Wall Streets Shiny New Thing
description: The situation was dire. As the pandemic raged in March, some Covid-19 patients in Milan were going into septic shock and their blood pressure was perilously low.

title: Menopause Stories
description: There are still many women who think that menopause is the end of your life.

title: Sundance Goes Virtual With a More Accessible 2021 Lineup
description: The movies still feel like Sundance. But without the snow, the parties and all those packed premieres, will Sundance still feel like Sundance?

title: To Cut Emissions to Zero, U.S. Needs to Make Big Changes in Next 10 Years
description: If the United States wants to get serious about tackling climate change, the country will need to build a staggering amount of new energy infrastructure in just the next 10 years, laying down steel and concrete at a pace barely being contemplated today.

title: I Wouldnt Have Known That My Mom Had Gone Through Menopause
description: About half of the worlds population will experience menopause, yet its a period that can be isolating for a woman in their personal and professional life. Menopause marks the end of menstruation, and the changes that come with it are often not discussed openly. In the short documentary above, women across England share their intimate, complicated and illuminating experiences with menopause. Its a conversation that should happen more often, and without fear.

title: Nursing Home Fire in Russia Kills 11
description: On Tuesday, a private nursing home in a village outside the capital of Russias steel industry, Magnitogorsk, burned down killing 11 residents.

title: Cond Nast Puts Anna Wintour in Charge of Magazines Worldwide
description: Going into this week, Anna Wintour was already one of the most powerful people in the magazine world. She has been the editor in chief of the United States edition of Vogue since 1988, the artistic director of Vogues parent, Cond Nast, since 2013, and the companys global content adviser since 2019.

title: Facebook lifts ban on political ads for Georgia runoff elections.
description: Facebook said on Tuesday that it would allow some advertisers to run political issue and candidacy ads in Georgia, a change from its recent ban on political ads in the United States and just weeks before a major runoff election in the state could decide the future of the Senate.

title: Who Is Jeffrey Rosen, Who Will Lead the Justice Dept. for Trumps Endgame?
description: WASHINGTON  When the deputy attorney general, Jeffrey A. Rosen, testified at his confirmation hearing in April 2019, he seemed to pledge to keep politics out of law enforcement decisions, telling the Senate: I would expect in all prosecutorial matters to proceed on the facts and the law and not any improper political influences.

title: Tiny Love Stories: Tears Start Before My Feet Stop
description: In 2017, on the way to our third family funeral in four weeks, our car died outside a Minnesota highway sex shop. I hopped around the parking lot to stay warm as my husband called the tow company. Were trying to get to a funeral, he said. Our car died outside of  Pure Pleasure. Hes always resilient, but I worried about his spirits; this was another setback during a harsh year. His mother and stepmother texted, suggesting that his recently deceased father had pranked us. We smiled, joking about going inside the shop to warm up, but the tow arrived.  Laura Logsdon

title: Republicans Said, Let the Voters Decide. They Have.
description: To the Editor:

title: John le Carr: Writer, Spy, Neighbor, Friend
description: LONDON I came to know David Cornwell, who wrote as John le Carr, just after the United States and Britain removed Saddam Hussein from power. He was a neighbor; we met in our local pub in Hampstead in North London. We were introduced by a mutual friend who knew the genial white-haired gentleman in brown suede shoes. Who was that? I asked as we reached our own table.

title: Carlos Araujo Preza, Doctor on the Pandemics Front Lines, Dies at 51
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo Signs $228 Million Extension With Bucks
description: Giannis Antetokounmpo redoubled his commitment to the only N.B.A. franchise he has known by signing a five-year contract extension worth an estimated $228 million from the Milwaukee Bucks.

title: In Sweden, Infections and Calls for a Lockdown Are Rising
description: Sweden has been an outlier in the pandemic: It eschewed lockdowns and kept restaurants, bars, schools, movie theaters and gyms mostly open. And while death rates were high compared to its Nordic neighbors, they were comparable to those of larger European countries.

title: We Are Not at the Finish Line, Newsom Says Despite Virus Vaccine
description: Gov. Gavin Newsom of California heralded the arrival of the coronavirus vaccine in his state, but he underscored the danger the state faces in the next few weeks.

title: Fed Joins Climate Network, to Applause From the Left
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve is joining a network of central banks and other financial regulators focused on conducting research and shaping policies to help prepare the financial system for the effects of climate change.

title: No, there arent alternate electors who can vote for President Trump.
description: Once the Electoral College has met and every states election has been certified, there is no constitutional provision for an alternate slate of electors. A group of people who gather in a room and claim they are electors, as state-party-backed Republicans did in a few states on Monday, have no more authority than if the people reading this article decided that they, too, wanted to be members of the Electoral College.

title: 18 Easy Holiday Desserts
description: Whether youre an experienced baker who makes a Hogwarts sorting hat croquembouche for fun, or a beginner who rarely turns on the oven, sometimes you want something delicious and festive that you can throw together in a snap. These 18 simple recipes are just that, and most of them take less prep time than it takes to watch The Grinch. (The 25-minute 1966 original, of course.)

title: Who is Jeffrey Rosen, the man set to take over the Justice Dept. for the last month of Trumps presidency?
description: Since the Senate confirmed him to be President Trumps deputy attorney general in 2019, Jeffrey A. Rosen has kept a low profile.

title: California Is Banning Short-Term Rentals. Why Cant Travelers Get Refunds?
description: Travel and travel planning are being disrupted by the worldwide spread of the coronavirus. For the latest updates, read The New York Timess Covid-19 coverage here.

title: Could Congress overturn Bidens Electoral College win? Possibly. Will it? No.
description: Even after the Electoral College certified President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. as the winner of the election on Monday, some of President Trumps staunchest allies in Congress refused to accept his loss, vowing that they could still reverse the results on the floor of the United States House of Representatives.

title: New & Noteworthy Visual Books, From Boxing to Hollywood Candids
description: FACE TO FACE: The Photographs of Camilla McGrath, by Camilla McGrath et al. (Knopf, $75.) From the 1950s to the 90s, the socialite captured casual moments with some of the biggest names in entertainment. More than 600 of her photos are here, with text from the likes of Harrison Ford and Fran Lebowitz.

title: Richard Hinch, Speaker of New Hampshire House, Dies at 71
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration released new data today confirming that Modernas vaccine was 94.1 percent effective in preventing Covid-19. The positive review means the agency is expected to authorize the vaccine for emergency use on Friday.

title: Running From Gunshots at the Cathedral With My Son
description: We almost didnt go. Id put the outdoor concert on our calendar, but as Sunday unfurled and some work I had to do relentlessly stared me down and inertia took hold of our family, I announced, If no one REALLY wants to go to the concert, were going to skip it.

title: Is the Legal System an Effective Solution to Domestic Violence?
description: FKA Twigs on how the actor Shia LaBeouf treated her

title: Best Comedy of 2020
description: The comedy boom finally busted. Not only did the pandemic shut down comedy institutions, but New York clubs like Dangerfields, which was half a century old, and the stalwart The Creek & the Cave closed for good, as did the citys branches of the improv powerhouse, the Upright Citizens Brigade. At the same time, comedians adjusted to the new abnormal, transitioning to Zoom and Instagram Live, and to shows in parks and on rooftops. It was a period of experimentation and stagnancy, contraction and accessibility, despair and occasional joy. In a low year, here were the highlights:

title: Children Love Snow Days. The Pandemic May End Them Forever.
description: [Noreaster live updates: Messy snowstorm moves up the East Coast.]

title: Gifts for Everyone on Your List (and We Mean Everyone)
description: Though the holiday season is upon us, you might still be looking for gifts for your hardest-to-shop-for acquaintances: quirky, picky, eccentric, fancy family members and friends.

title: Moderna, Joe Biden, Giannis Antetokounmpo: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Biden Campaigns in Georgia Ahead of Crucial Runoffs
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. arrived in Atlanta on Tuesday one day after in-person early voting began. He encouraged Georgians to vote for Democratic Senate candidates in two critical runoffs next month that could give his party full control of Congress.

title: How to Pet-Proof Your Holiday Decor
description: The holidays are a magical time even for pets, but the cheerful decor can be harmful if youre not careful.

title: Biden to Pick Jennifer Granholm, Former Michigan Governor, for Energy Secretary
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Joseph R. Biden will nominate Jennifer M. Granholm, a former governor of Michigan and a longtime champion of renewable energy development, to be the next secretary of energy, according to four people close to the president-elects transition team.

title: Defying Trump, McConnell Seeks to Squelch Bid to Overturn the Election
description: Breaking with President Trumps drive to overturn his election loss, Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky on Tuesday congratulated President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. on his victory and began a campaign to keep fellow Republicans from joining a doomed last-ditch effort to reverse the outcome in Congress.

title: The Vaccine Arrived in a 63-Pound Box, Packed in Dry Ice
description: The first shipment of the vaccine arrived at a loading dock in Queens shortly after sunrise on Monday. The head pharmacist for one of Northwell Healths hospitals, who had been tracking the package, opened the 63-pound box, packed in dry ice. He took out a single vial.

title: Where Does American Democracy Go From Here?
description: This article is part of the Debatable newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

title: D.C. Passes Bill to Give Young Offenders Chance at Reduced Sentences
description: WASHINGTON  The District of Columbia Council passed legislation on Tuesday that would give people who committed crimes as young adults a chance to have their sentences reduced, reflecting a growing national debate over whether offenders in their late teens and early 20s should be treated the same as older people when it comes to sentencing.

title: Drug Makers Are Pulling Back From a Program to Help the Needy
description: WASHINGTON  Some of the nations top pharmaceutical companies have stopped giving federally mandated drug discounts to hospitals and clinics that care for the poorest Americans, a move that is prompting bipartisan calls for the health secretary, Alex M. Azar II, to demand reinstatement of the price breaks or punish the firms.

title: Dominions C.E.O. defends his firms voting machines to Michigan lawmakers, denouncing a reckless disinformation campaign.
description: A day after Michigans 16 electoral votes formally went to President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr., a voting machine manufacturer told state senators that he stood by his companys work, and shot down unfounded allegations that the results may have been manipulated.

title: Biden to Name Gina McCarthy, Former E.P.A. Chief, as White House Climate Coordinator
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. is expected to pick Gina McCarthy, the former administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency under President Barack Obama and the architect of some of his most far-reaching regulations to limit greenhouse gas emissions, to serve as senior White House adviser on climate change, according to three people close to the Biden transition team.

title: Kamala Harris Deserves a More Important Job
description: I was speaking recently to Matt Dunne, founder of the Center on Rural Innovation, which promotes digital economic development in small-town America, and he was telling me about a Vermont community near his home with a great public library: You could drive by on any Sunday and the parking lot would be full, he said. There was just one problem: The library was closed on Sundays.

title: Hes Too Quiet for His Mate to Hear Him. So He Makes a Megaphone.
description: For better or for worse, female tree crickets tend to prioritize two traits in their mates: loudness and size. The louder the boy cricket, the more likely a lady is to be wooed by his serenade. The larger he is when she finds him, the more time she will stay locked in a sexual tryst  in some cases, up to an hour of rollicking, sperm-shuttling fun.

title: Leaders in Congress Meet in Search of Spending and Stimulus Deals
description: WASHINGTON Congressional leaders scrambled on Tuesday to reach agreement on a stimulus bill and a catchall omnibus funding package to keep government funding flowing, meeting to try to hammer out critical spending deals ahead of a Friday deadline.

title: Trump Didnt Break Our Democracy. But Did He Fatally Weaken It?
description: After the Electoral College vote on Monday affirming his election, Joe Biden declared that nothing, not even a pandemic or an abuse of power, can extinguish the flame of democracy. Mr. Bidens speech and the vote capped a series of victories for democratic institutions, including the Supreme Courts dismissal of a Texas lawsuit that sought to overturn the election results  just the latest turn in the extended refusal of President Trump and his Republican enablers to accept the outcome.

title: Campaigning in Georgia, Biden Presses for the Senate Majority He Will Need
description: ATLANTA  President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Tuesday urged Georgia voters to cast ballots for two Democratic Senate candidates in a pair of critical runoffs early next month that he hopes will give his party control of the Senate and help Democrats advance the agenda he promised during his campaign.

title: U.S. and Pfizer Are Negotiating Deal for More Vaccine Doses Next Year
description: The Trump administration is negotiating a deal to use its power to free up supplies of raw materials to help Pfizer produce tens of millions of additional doses of its Covid-19 vaccine for Americans in the first half of next year, people familiar with the situation said.

title: MacKenzie Scott Announces $4.2 Billion More in Charitable Giving
description: In her short career as one of the worlds leading philanthropists, MacKenzie Scott has made a mark through the enormous scale of her giving and also through its speed, donating nearly $6 billion of her fortune this year alone.

title: Biden Taps Pete Buttigieg for Transportation Secretary
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. will nominate Pete Buttigieg to be secretary of transportation, Mr. Bidens transition team announced Tuesday, selecting a former mayor of South Bend, Ind., and former opponent who would bring a younger voice to the cabinet and add to its diversity as its first openly gay member.

title: Bidens Climate Team Begins to Take Shape
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. is expected to announce a significant part of his energy and environment team this week.

title: Mexico, in Rebuke to U.S., Adopts Measure Restricting Foreign Agents
description: MEXICO CITY  Lawmakers in Mexico approved legislation Tuesday that could sharply limit cooperation with American narcotics agents, delivering a stinging rebuke to the United States after its short-lived arrest of a former Mexican official brought tensions to a boil.

title: The U.S. and Pfizer are negotiating a deal for more vaccine doses next year.
description: The Trump administration is negotiating a deal to use its power to free up supplies of raw materials to help Pfizer produce tens of millions of additional doses of its Covid-19 vaccine for Americans in the first half of next year, people familiar with the situation said.

title: Santa Tests Positive for Virus After Photo Session With 50 Children
description: A Georgia couple who dressed up as Santa and Mrs. Claus for an outdoor photo session that was attended by about 50 children last week learned that they had tested positive for the coronavirus three days after the event, the countys top elected official said on Tuesday.

title: A man who rode a Jet Ski across the Irish Sea to see his girlfriend was jailed for defying virus restrictions.
description: Last Thursday, Dale Mclaughlan bought a Jet Ski.

title: Myon Burrell Released From Prison in Minnesota
description: Myon Burrell, who was sentenced to life in prison as a teenager in a murder case, was released on Tuesday after a vote by the Minnesota Board of Pardons. His case gained national attention after serious flaws in the police investigation came to light.

title: Something You Grin and Bare
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  When you have spent your career working as a cryptologist, its plausible to believe that you went into the field because you enjoy interpreting information and deciphering codes.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Corrections: Dec. 16, 2020
description: A picture caption with an article on Tuesday about the Electoral Colleges affirmation of Joe Bidens victory misidentified an elector. He is Calvin Smyre, not Van Johnson.

title: Minnesota Releases Myon Burrell, Man Given Life Sentence After a Murder
description: Myon Burrell, 34, was released from a state prison on Tuesday after the Minnesota Board of Pardons commuted his life sentence in a murder case that angered advocates of criminal justice reform and hampered Senator Amy Klobuchars presidential campaign.

title: Quotation of the Day: Rush by Rich Countries to Reserve Early Doses Leaves the Poor Behind
description: The high-income countries have gotten to the front of the line and cleared the shelves.

title: Disabled Former N.F.L. Players Get a Reprieve on Benefit Cuts
description: When the N.F.L. Players Association agreed in March to cut payments to some of the leagues most vulnerable former players by reducing their disability benefits starting Jan. 1, 2021, the decision was met with outrage and legal challenges from retired players and their families.

title: Was Merkel Right to Compromise With the Populists?
description: VIENNA  The philosopher Avishai Margalit was born in 1939, at the onset of World War II, and has lived most of his life in Israel, a country that has always existed between war and peace. That the value of political compromise has always occupied Professor Margalits thinking should come as no surprise. He is haunted by how political compromise becomes an act of political maturity and moral responsibility, and under what conditions it becomes morally unacceptable.

title: Tom Cruise Erupts at Mission: Impossible Crew Over Covid-19 Breach
description: The actor Tom Cruise recently erupted at crew members on the set of Mission: Impossible 7 over a breach of Covid-19 protocols in an apparent effort to prevent further disruptions to a film whose production has already been delayed by the pandemic.

title: Word + Quiz: rakish
Tom Cruise erupts at the Mission: Impossible crew over a breach of Covid-19 protocols.
description: The actor Tom Cruise recently erupted at crew members on the set of Mission: Impossible 7 over a breach of Covid-19 protocols. His expletive-laden rant was an apparent effort to prevent further disruptions to a film whose production has already been delayed by the pandemic.

title: Some Republicans Finally Face Their Biggest Fear: Reality, Colbert Says
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Were all stuck at home at the moment, so here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Five Minutes of Beethoven
description: Beethoven was born 250 years ago this month and The Times is celebrating. In 5 Minutes That Will Make You Love Beethoven, Times music editors and other experts invite you to  listen to the best of the stormy, tender work of the composer who changed music.

title: Can Any A.F.C. Team Catch the Chiefs?
description: The only real danger to the Kansas City Chiefs in the playoffs will be the Chiefs themselves.

title: Suspect Is Charged With Murder Over Japan Animation Studio Fire
description: TOKYO  Japanese prosecutors on Wednesday charged a man with arson and murder in connection with a fire last year that killed 36 at an animation studio in Kyoto, the countrys deadliest attack in decades.

title: A snowstorm in the Northeast threatens to snarl vaccine deliveries.
description: The major winter storm bearing down on the Northeast has the potential to snarl distribution of the Pfizer-BioNTech coronavirus vaccine in the region.

title: Huge pileups leave dead and injured on treacherous roads.
description: The fast-moving winter storm that barreled through the Mid-Atlantic and into the Northeast on Wednesday and Thursday created hazardous road conditions in the affected areas.

title: The Most Valuable Condiment of 2020: Salsa Macha
description: Every time I open the fridge  bored, peckish, frenzied, whatever the mood  Im reassured by a small clutter of condiments. Preserved lemons from a neighbors tree. Sludgy garlic pickles in a distressingly greasy jar. Tubs of fermented bean pastes and bottles of fish sauce, mouths crusted with salty crystals.

title: Fantasia, Snow White, Betty Boop, Popeye and the First Golden Age of Animation
description: By the time Walt Disneys Fantasia premiered at Manhattans Broadway Theater on Nov. 13, 1940, what had started out as an animated short to revive Mickey Mouses flagging career had become a feature-length extravaganza. Images in the movie channeled evolutionary theory and abstract art, depicting roaring dinosaurs, vibrating shapes and dancing brooms. Everything was set to classical music and blasted over the new Fantasound system, whose volume could apparently reach 165 decibels  enough, The New Yorker reported at the time, to kill many elderly members of the audience, knock the others cold and deafen the survivors for life. The magazine continued: Dont worry about it, though. Youre safe with Walt Disney.

title: The Magic Number for Reducing Infections and Keeping Businesses Open
description: Data from early in the pandemic reveals theres a sweet spot.

title: Her Wrist Was Swollen and Excruciatingly Painful. Steroids Didnt Help Much.
description: It was the worst pain she had ever felt, the 57-year-old woman told Dr. Mark Vitale. He was a hand surgeon in Greenwich, Conn.  part of the same practice she had visited earlier that year for pain in her hips. But this wrist pain was so much worse.

title: He Wanted to Count Every Vote in Philadelphia. His Party Had Other Ideas.
description: To hear more audio stories from publishers like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: For This Christmas Tree Farmer, Its the Best Year Ive Ever Seen
description: Plantations Ral Beloin is a family-run tree farm in Quebec that has been operating since the 1980s. This year, it sold out of trees in August and packed up his its last shipment to the U.S. on Thanksgiving weekend.

title: We Asked: Why Does Oreo Keep Releasing New Flavors?
description: The team of people who come up with limited-edition Oreo flavors and collaborations is a half-dozen strong and extremely secretive. Their privacy is so tightly guarded, said Justin Parnell, the senior director of the Oreo brand, that he could not even reveal the teams name.

title: My 50-Pound Bag of Flour Is Gone. My Sanity Remains.
description: For a few innocent weeks about 10,000 years ago, at the dawn of the quarantine era of 2020, my Instagram feed and perhaps yours, too, was suddenly overrun with images of impossibly lovely loaves of homemade bread. It was one of the first social-media show-off fads of the pandemic; with everyone stuck at home, cut off from gym mirrors and airplane wings at sunset, bread-making virtuosity emerged in certain circles as the hottest new way to show everyone online how much better you were than everyone else.

title: When Can We Start Making Plans?
description: The United States moved one step closer to getting back to normal this week with the first Covid vaccinations of health care workers around the country. While the majority of Americans wont get their shots until spring, the vaccine rollout is a hopeful sign of better days ahead. We asked Dr. Anthony S. Fauci, as well as several epidemiologists and health and science writers for The Times, for their predictions about the months ahead. Heres what they had to say.

title: Makeup Without the Markup
description: Some people are lucky enough to have one good idea in life that they then build into a successful business. Marcia Kilgore had five.

title: Time to Break Out the Lipstick
description: Like so many things this year, holiday get-togethers  perhaps attended on Zoom, possibly in leggings hidden from the computer screen  dont look all that much like a traditional seasonal gathering.

title: What the Asian-American Coalition Can Teach the Democrats
description: In coalition politics, every part of the coalition matters, especially when elections are close. For Democrats, Asian-Americans are suddenly crucial: They are the fastest-growing racial or ethnic group in the U.S. electorate, constituting 4.7 percent of the voting population  enough to make a difference in the presidential contest in Georgia, where Joe Biden won by some 12,000 votes.

title: 2020: A Year in Fitness Like No Other
description: This year, the novel coronavirus crept into and transformed every aspect of our lives, including our fitness. In countless ways  some surprising, and a few beneficial and potentially lasting  it altered how, why and what we need from exercise.

title: This Is the Health System That Biden Inherits From Trump
description: President-elect Joe Biden will inherit a health system that is trying to care for a population made sicker by both coronavirus and skipped preventive care, all while trying to make up for money lost in 2020.

title: It Took Mitch McConnell Six Weeks
description: Early this week, electors in 50 states and Washington, D.C., formally chose Joe Biden as the next president of the United States.

title: The Endless Debate: Cancel or Rebook?
description: A 50th birthday, 50 new places: That was Allison Andrews plan for the year.

title: Like a Hand Grasping: Trump Appointees Describe the Crushing of the C.D.C.
description: ATLANTA  Kyle McGowan, a former chief of staff at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, and his deputy, Amanda Campbell, were installed in 2018 as two of the youngest political appointees in the history of the worlds premier public health agency, young Republicans returning to their native Georgia to dream jobs.

title: Senator Jon Tester on Democrats and Rural Voters: Our Message Is Really, Really Flawed
description: President Trump visited Montana four times in 2018 as part of the Republican Partys attempt at unseating Senator Jon Tester. It didnt work: Mr. Tester was re-elected that year to a third term.

title: Nikki Giovanni, Finding the Song in the Darkest Days
description: Over the course of her 52-year career, Nikki Giovanni has written 12 childrens books and eight nonfiction books, and she has released 10 spoken word albums. But the genre for which she is best known is poetry.

title: America, We Have a Problem
description: The turbulence that followed the Nov. 3 election has roiled American politics, demonstrating an ominous vulnerability in our political system.

title: What Makes You Think 2021 Will Be Better?
description: Im not a Debbie Downer. Far from it. Im usually an optimist who pushes for hope in the most dire of circumstances. However, when I hear friends talk about how the new year and Joe Bidens presidency will answer our collective prayers and cleanse our collective palate from 2020s unrelenting onslaught of pain and misery, I cant help but feel skeptical.

title: Why Christmas Tree Sellers Feel Like Lucy at Her Psychiatrist Stand
description: Diana Karvelis spent 15 minutes choosing just the right Christmas tree  a five-footer that cost $65  at a stand in the East Village on a freezing weekday night.

title: Fed Closes Out Wild Year as All Eyes Focus on Bond-Buying Program
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve is wrapping up what might be the most activist year in its history with a final scheduled policy meeting this week, one at which it is expected to leave interest rates at rock bottom and to signal continued willingness to help the economy through the challenging pandemic era.

title: Living In ... Newburgh, N.Y.
description: As many New Yorkers have discovered, this Orange County city doesnt just have good bones, it is magnificent  and still relatively affordable.

title: Pandemic Leaves More Military Families Seeking Food Assistance
description: WASHINGTON  Fort Bragg, the largest military base in the United States, has all the trappings of a small American city: shopping centers, a barber shop and social clubs. In a sign of the times, it also has a food bank.

title: Newburgh, N.Y.: Onetime Jewel of the Hudson River
description: Eight years before she moved up to Newburgh, Cher Vickers started a blog called Newburgh Restoration. Writing from the Bronx and then Amityville, N.Y., she sang the praises of this city of 28,000 in Orange County that not so long ago was called the murder capital of New York. Many of the posts featured luscious Victorian houses  some intact, others not so much  each a representative of the states largest historic district outside of New York City.

title: Counting on Biden, M.T.A. Shifts From Doomsday Budget to a Wishful One
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority has warned for months that the agency would be forced to make draconian cuts, including slashing New York Citys subway service by 40 percent, as the pandemic plunged the nations largest public transit agency into its worst financial crisis.

title: A Portraitist Whose Subjects Are All in Her Head
description: The British artist Lynette Yiadom-Boakye is a committed painter of people. Every piece she shows is, on first impression, a portrait  a careful study of one person, or, at most, a small group, with little to distract from their presence and force.

title: From Voter Fraud to Vaccine Lies: Misinformation Peddlers Shift Gears
description: Sidney Powell, a lawyer who was part of President Trumps legal team, spread a conspiracy theory last month about election fraud. For days, she claimed that she would release the Kraken by showing voluminous evidence that Mr. Trump had won the election by a landslide.

title: How Putting on a Mask Raised Naomi Osakas Voice
description: As usual, Naomi Osakas postmatch interview struck an emotional chord.

title: As cases surge and criticism swells, Sweden rethinks its response.
description: Since the pandemic began, a debate has raged both inside and outside of Sweden over how to curb the virus. As other countries went into lockdown in the spring, Sweden stayed open out of concern that keeping everyone holed up at home would have long-term detrimental effects on children and adults and could lead to depression, suicide, postponed health care and job losses.

title: The pandemic has forced more military families and veterans to seek food assistance.
description: This spring, the Y.M.C.A. on Fort Bragg, the largest military base in the United States, saw a 40 percent increase in requests for groceries at its food pantry. During the same period, grocery requests to AmericaServes, a network that helps military families, jumped to the biggest service request in the organizations history.

title: Snow in N.Y.C.: When Will It Start, and How Much Will Fall?
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: How Russia Wins the Climate Crisis
description: Climate change is propelling enormous human migrations, transforming global agriculture and remaking the world order  and no country stands to gain more than Russia.

title: Heres how the Trump administration crushed the C.D.C., according to two who were there.
description: Kyle McGowan, a former chief of staff at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, and his deputy, Amanda Campbell, were installed in 2018 as two of the youngest political appointees in the history of the worlds premier public health agency, young Republicans returning to their native Georgia to dream jobs.

title: What is a noreaster, exactly?
description: The word noreaster usually elicits images of streets blanketed in heaps of snow and power lines defeated by intense winds. But what, exactly, makes a storm a noreaster?

title: Trains and lockdown chaos helped spread the coronavirus across India.
description: SURAT, India  The crowds surged through the gates, fought their way up the stairs of the 160-year-old station, poured across the platforms and engulfed the trains.

title: Who Made My Puzzle?
description: Mountain View, Calif.

title: How Capitalism Is Coping in an Era of Populism
description: Recent years have seen a marked rise of populism, as leaders like President Trump tapped into fury over growing chasms in society to assume power and reshape American institutions. Even President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr., an embodiment of the Washington establishment for decades, has embraced populist elements in his platform. (Core to his Build Back Better plan is Buy American, after all.)

title: How to Revive the Economy, and When to Worry About All That Debt
description: The coronavirus pandemic has taken a brutal toll on the U.S. economy. Job losses resulting from the health crisis wiped out years worth of gains, hitting women, people of color and lower-paid workers already vulnerable to economic swings the hardest. An estimated 60 percent of businesses  about 100,000 individual establishments  that closed their doors temporarily as a result of Covid-19 have shut down for good, and more may follow in the months to come.

title: Hacked, Again
description: Once again, hackers working on behalf of a foreign government have been able to breach U.S. government computer networks.

title: Comparing Virus Surges
description: Its happening again: For the second time this year, the United States has fallen behind nearly every other country in combating the virus.

title: Pantomimes, an annual British cultural institution, are canceled.
description: The pantomime  merry, family-friendly musical comedy shows which take top billing at theaters throughout December  remains a peculiarly British tradition. It is nominally a childrens Christmas show based on a fairy tale such as Sleeping Beauty, Cinderella or Jack and the Beanstalk to which music-hall elements are added. Those include the dame (an actor in drag, who usually has a penchant for sexual innuendo), song-and-dance routines with topical lyrics, slapstick, in-jokes, call-and-response (Oh no it isnt! Oh yes it is!) and familiar celebrity guest stars.

title: How to Get a Fragrant Tween to Shower
description: As stay-at-home orders return and each day seems to blend into the next, Im hearing from colleagues and readers alike that their older kids are resisting shower time. While the littler ones can get by with a full bath once or twice a week, unless theyve decided to make mud pies, the older ones get  lets say, fragrant. If youre nestled up beside them doing online learning, that makes for a distinctly unpleasant familial experience.

title: Companies crucial to vaccine distribution are seeing a flurry of investments.
description: Until recently, the temperature-controlled storage and shipping of pharmaceutical products, known as the cold chain, was a relatively sleepy corner of the health care industry.

title: Advocacy groups are rushing to get aid to renters before a federal cutoff date.
description: Almost from the moment the pandemic spread across the United States, advocacy groups have warned that the economic fallout could cause mass displacement of low-income tenants.

title: Biden Rallies Democrats in Georgia
description: McConnell congratulates Biden on his victory for the first time, while Biden is down in Georgia trying to claw the Senate majority away from him. Its Wednesday, and this is your politics tip sheet. Sign up here to get On Politics in your inbox every weekday.

title: Wall Street Sees Cold, Hard Cash in Vaccine Storage
description: As Pfizers Covid-19 vaccine is rolled out across the U.S. and Modernas moves closer to gaining emergency approval, financiers are  naturally  seeking ways to profit. As The Timess Kate Kelly reports, one popular path runs through the normally unsexy business of medical freezers.

title: Turkeys coffeehouses, a hub of male social life, may not survive the pandemic.
description: For years, Varan Suzme has frequented the Kiral Coffeehouse near his home, where men of his Istanbul neighborhood while away hours chatting, sipping from tiny, steaming cups and playing backgammon and cards.

title: China Battles the Worlds Biggest Coal Exporter, and Coal Is Losing
description: SYDNEY, Australia  China is forcing Australia to confront what many countries are concluding: The coal era is coming to an end.

title: Go inside the race to offer the first Covid-19 vaccinations in the United States.
description: Hospitals around the country who have been waiting months for the first doses rapidly scrambled to put together events after unknowns about the vaccine and its distribution made it difficult to perfectly plan for its arrival.

title: China Charges Hong Kong Activists Caught Fleeing to Taiwan
description: HONG KONG  Ten Hong Kong activists who were captured at sea while trying to flee to Taiwan in August were charged in mainland China on Wednesday with illegal boundary-crossing offenses that could put some of them behind bars for years.

title: How Should Racial Slurs in Literature Be Handled in the Classroom?
description: Have you ever been assigned to read a book that included racial slurs? How was that material introduced to you by your teacher? Were students given instructions for how to handle the racial slur when reading aloud? How did you feel and react when engaging with that content?

title: Wealthier, Whiter Areas Are More Likely to Get Help After Fires, Data Show
description: WASHINGTON  Wealthier and whiter neighborhoods stricken by wildfires are more likely to get help to reduce the risk of future fires, new data suggest, the latest evidence that racial and economic inequality leaves some Americans more exposed to the worsening effects of climate change.

title: Trump Administration Says Vietnam and Switzerland Manipulated Currency
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration on Wednesday labeled Vietnam and Switzerland currency manipulators, accusing them for the first time of improperly intervening in foreign exchange markets and setting off a new economic confrontation with two trading partners.

title: Red Flags for Economy as Retail Sales Fall for a Second Month
description: Consumer spending has been one of the few bright spots in the pandemic-battered economy. Since the spring, Americans have spent more each month even in the face of mounting job losses, political turmoil and recurring virus outbreaks.

title: Bidens climate team begins to take shape.
description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. is expected to announce a significant part of his energy and environment team this week.

title: The steady pace of Bidens announcements frustrates some progressives in his party.
description: Many in the left wing of the Democratic Party want President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. to move faster in announcing substantive plans for his administration, such as a sweeping plan to bring the coronavirus crisis under control, urging him to provide more than just glimpses of what he might do early on.

title: A bolder Russia is setting up to be a greater challenge for Biden than Obama.
description: The extensive hack of American government computer systems, almost certainly orchestrated by the Kremlin, underscores the daunting foreign policy challenge that President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia poses to the incoming Biden administration.

title: This Was Coming Full Circle
description: Good morning.

title: Red Sox. White Sox. Blue Sox? Manny Is Still Manny.
description: Adam Dobb thought he was being punked.

title: How to Send a Recap of 2020 to Friends and Family
description: For many people, 2020 has been a disruptive, frustrating, heartbreaking and disorienting year. But as December winds down, its also an opportunity to take stock of the things that happened and to let your friends and family know how youve been doing through it all.

title: What You Get for $700,000
description: A soaring kit house in Catskill, N.Y.; a two-bedroom condominium in an 1852 mansion in Newport, R.I.; and a limestone house in Bloomington, Ind.

title: $700,000 Homes in New York, Rhode Island and Indiana
description: This kit house from the Backcountry Hut Company, in Vancouver, British Columbia, was finished by local craft workers.
